meanings.definition: A person who raises petty objections or engages in nitpicking.
meanings.sent1: The quibblers in the meeting kept pointing out small mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The group of quibblers always finds something to complain about.
meanings.sent3: The quibblers at the party argued over the tiniest details of the decorations.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the quibbler of the family, always finding faults in everything.
meanings.sent5: The teacher described the student as a quibbler, never satisfied with any answer given.

meanings.definition: To argue or raise objections about trivial matters.
meanings.sent1: Stop quibbling over the small details and focus on the main issue.
meanings.sent2: He tends to quibble about everything, even the color of the walls.
meanings.sent3: The siblings quibbled over who should sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent4: The politicians continued to quibble about the wording of the bill.
meanings.sent5: She quibbled with her friend about the best way to solve the puzzle.
